FuncDef:
The renew-time-percent rebind-time-percent command sets the renewal time and rebinding time of an IPv6 address pool.
The undo renew-time-percent rebind-time-percent command restores the default renewal time and rebinding time of an IPv6 address pool.
By default, the renewal time is 50% the preferred lifetime; the rebinding time is 80% the preferred lifetime.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the rebinding time of an IPv6 address pool. rebind-time-percent is the percentage of the rebinding time to the preferred lifetime. renew-time-percent must be smaller than rebind-time-percent by not less than 10.
You can set the preferred lifetime by using the lifetime preferred-lifetime command.
The value ranges from 10 to 99, and the default value is 80.

Specifies the renewal time of an IPv6 address pool. renew-time-percent is the percentage of the renewal time to the preferred lifetime.
The value ranges from 10 to 99, and the default value is 50.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When you need to change the renewal time and rebinding time of an IPv6 address pool, you can use the renew-time-percent rebind-time-percent command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
